title: Updated Version Scheme for Notebook Automation
details:
**Version Scheme Implementation**

The Notebook Automation CLI now uses a comprehensive automatic versioning scheme applied consistently across all build scenarios:

## Directory.Build.props
A central props file manages version settings for all projects in the solution:
```xml
<Project>
  <PropertyGroup>
    <!-- Set the version for all projects in the solution -->
    <Version>1.0.0.*</Version>
    <AssemblyVersion>1.0.0.*</AssemblyVersion>
    <FileVersion>1.0.0.*</FileVersion>
    <InformationalVersion>1.0.0-development</InformationalVersion>
    <!-- Enable deterministic builds for CI -->
    <Deterministic>false</Deterministic>
    <Company>Dan Shue</Company>
    <Copyright>Copyright Â© 2025</Copyright>
    <Product>Notebook Automation</Product>
    <Authors>Dan Shue</Authors>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```

## Local Build Script
For local builds (build-ci-local.ps1), a timestamp-based format is used:
- Version format: `1.0.0.yyMMdd.HHmm` (e.g., 1.0.0.250603.1423)
- The version is generated at build time and passed to all assemblies

## CI/GitHub Actions
For CI builds:
- Version format: `1.0.0.{build_number}` where build_number is the GitHub Actions run number
- This ensures each CI build has a unique, sequential version
- The version is applied consistently to:
  - All project assemblies during build
  - Published executable files

## Version Helper
A VersionHelper utility class provides comprehensive version information:
- Assembly version
- File version
- Build timestamp (extracted from PE header)
- Runtime and OS details
- Company and copyright information

## CLI Commands
Version information is accessible via:
1. Basic: `version` - shows core version details
2. Detailed: `version detailed` - shows all version metadata

This versioning scheme ensures all assemblies and executables have consistent versioning, with automatic incrementation suitable for both local development and CI pipelines.

Implemented: June 3, 2025
